channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

Report E-2023070198

item.title: Report E-2023070146
item.description:
Report E-2023070146

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-26T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged and released approximately one (1) tablespoon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted surface. ES personnel utilized an aqueous degreasing solution and absorbent pads to wipe down the trailer floor. Crews placed the damaged 5-gallon pail of printing ink into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum that was labeled as "hazardous" and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/15/2023 this shipment had hidden dangerous goods that were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the at the DHL JFK service center, Bldg 263, JFK Int'I Airport, Jamaica, NY 11430 Transportation by road has been confirmed.

item.title: Report X-2023061678
item.description:
Report X-2023061678

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: BINGHAMTON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Q.A. was walking past the overhead conveyor belt and noticed a jammed and leaking hazmat. DescribePack: the caps on inner bottles failed while in transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the hazmat was taken off the belt carefully and placed in a bucket to be transported to the hazmat cage to be evaluated and repacked into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023070073
item.description:
Report E-2023070073

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: CASTLETON ON HUDSON
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a pallet that had boxes on it that had been crushed by top freight loaded onto it consequently crushing inner containers contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as were the crushed containers.

item.title: Report X-2023061620
item.description:
Report X-2023061620

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When walking the load dock, I was informed that a package had a leakage. The package in fact had liquid pouring out of it at a rapid speed. I immediately obtained a hazemat bag and bucket to contain the liquid. DescribePack: The cap was off the gallon hypochlorite solution DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottle was put right side up

item.title: Report X-2023061612
item.description:
Report X-2023061612

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: LONG ISLAND CITY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: SEQUENCE OF EVENTS IS UNKNOWN. DescribePack: THIS PKG CONTAINS FOUR PLASTIC CONTAINERS OF DISINFECTANT SOLUTION. UNFORTUNATELY, THIS PACKAGE BECAME DAMAGED WHILE IN TRANSIT. ONE OF THE CONTAINERS HAS NO SEAL AND A LOOSE CAP. AS A RESULT, SOME OF THE LIQUID HAS LEAKED OUT OF THE CONTAINER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PKG WAS PLACED IN A LARGE PLASTIC BAG AND PLACED IN OUR DAMAGED HAZMAT AREA.
